references.reason: This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), which the DICEPTION paper compares its point-prompted segmentation performance against, achieving comparable results with significantly less data.
This paper presents the DiT architecture, which the DICEPTION model adopts, enabling scalability and efficiency in the diffusion model.

references.paper_title: Llama: Open and efficient foundation language models
references.reason: This paper presents the LLaMA model, a foundational large language model which is used as a base for developing other types of diffusion models.

references.paper_title: Masked autoencoders are scalable vision learners
references.reason: This paper introduces Masked Autoencoders, a technique for scalable vision learning that enables efficient training and leveraging of large datasets.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Latent Diffusion Models, a type of diffusion model, which enables high-resolution image synthesis and serves as a foundation for building more advanced diffusion models.
